clinical_summary: 45-year-old female presents with chronic low back pain (M54.5) and left-sided lumbar radiculopathy (M54.51) persisting for over 6 months. Conservative management including 8 weeks of physical therapy (2x/week) and NSAIDs (naproxen 500mg BID) has failed to provide adequate relief. Patient reports progressive numbness in left foot over the past 3 weeks, consistent with L5-S1 nerve root involvement. No prior lumbar imaging on record. MRI of the lumbar spine without contrast is medically necessary per LCD L34220 to evaluate for disc herniation or spinal stenosis and guide further treatment planning.

supporting_evidence.evidence: M54.5 (low back pain) and M54.51 (lumbar radiculopathy, left side) documented in assessment. Both are covered diagnoses per LCD L34220 / A57206.

supporting_evidence.criterion_label: Cauda equina, tumor, infection, major neuro deficit
supporting_evidence.evidence: Progressive neurological deficit identified: numbness in left foot worsening over 3 weeks, consistent with L5-S1 nerve root compression. This constitutes an immediate MRI indication per LCD L34220.
Physical therapy (2x/week for 8 weeks) and NSAIDs (naproxen 500mg BID for 6 weeks) documented with no improvement. Exceeds the 4-week minimum required by LCD L34220.

Clinical rationale clearly documented: persistent radiculopathy with progressive neurological symptoms despite conservative therapy. Structural pathology (disc herniation, spinal stenosis) suspected and requires imaging confirmation to guide treatment.
No prior lumbar CT or MRI found in patient record. This is the initial advanced imaging request for this episode of care.

field_mappings.Planned Service or Procedure Diagnosis D: Low back pain; Lumbar radiculopathy, left (ICD-10)
field_mappings.SECTION VI CLINICAL DOCUMENTATION SEE I: Patient presents with chronic low back pain and left-sided lumbar radiculopathy persisting for 6+ months. Conservative management (PT 2x/week x 8 weeks, naproxen 500mg BID x 6 weeks) has failed. Progressive L5 numbness in left foot over past 3 weeks. MRI lumbar spine w/o contrast medically necessary per LCD L34220 to evaluate disc herniation/stenosis. All LCD criteria met. Policy: lcd-mri-lumbar-L34220.
